note: Received cash from C. M. Banks, $125.00.
Fowler, 1 Bench, $12.00.
title: Received cash from Dreamland Amusement Co., $333.20, discount $6.80. 28. Sold for cash to Mrs

note: Paid salaries, by checks, as follows: S. N. Monroe, salesman, $75.00; (yourself), bookkeeper, $60.00; Roy Thomas, truck driver, $50.00. 30. Make entry for salary allowance of W. H. Watkins. Merchandise Inventory June 30, $4738.50.
title: Paid Standard Garage for gasoline and oil $28.64; Wilkins Office Supply Co. for stationery, $15.75; McLen Printing Co
Watkins check for $250.00. 29. Gave check to The Parker Insurance Agency for W

title: 3. Receive a bill from P
for account books and miscellaneous office supplies
7, and treat it as you have treated similar bills

container-title: also two invoices from The J. K. Armsby Co
title: Receive an invoice from The Diamond Match Co
The shipping clerk returns orders No
8, sent in by Kennedy

note: for bills of the 12th. 20. Receive credit memorandum from the Biloxi Canning Co., for rebate on the headless shrimp found to be of poor quality (No. 16). Make an entry for this credit memorandimi in the purchases rebates and allowances book.
title: also complain of the headless shrimp which were sold to them on the 16th. Allow them a rebate of 15c per can, prepare a credit memorandum and make the proper entry for this credit
Deliver to the shipping clerk order No. 22, which has just been received from the traveling salesman

note: Receive check (No. 13
Adkins for the 60-day bill of the 13th.
title: in payment of bills of the 10th

container-title: in settlement of bills of the 16th
note: Deposit all checks on hand.

container-title: 27. Receive an invoice of soaps from The N. K. Fairbank Co
note: Order No. 26 has been returned by the shipping clerk. 28. Receive order No. 27.
title: 27. Deposit the check just received. 27
Receive a bill for advertising (No. 18)from The Grocers' Criterion Company. Pay it by check.Charge Advertising account

note: J^ cases are counted as one piece.
title: Verify this bill as you did a previous teaming bill and O
Make a journal entry for this accrual of interest. Charge Accrued Interest account and credit Interest account

container-title: in settlement of invoice of Jan
note: The goods for order No. 34 have been shipped.
title: Receive a bill from the Chicago Telephone Company for telephone service for one quarter in advance; the instrument was installed Feb
Pay the bill by check

note: Feb. 8, The goods for order No. 37 have been shipped. 8.
Note that the coffee, which is ordered in No. 40, is to be roasted. The coffee cannot be shipped until the roasting is done.
title: for shipping boxes. 9. The shipping clerk returns order
Draw a check for $15.00 in favor of Mr. Parker and charge it to his personal account. 10

note: Pay, by check, the bill of the Sheboygan Cheese Co., of the 1st inst.
title: 10. Receive a check
for the bills of Jan

container-title: In the trade this is called a "pick-up" order. The goods will be ordered from The American Cereal Co
title: Note that this order calls for a cereal which the firm does not carry in stock
15. Receive a check
Wetzel for the 60-day bill of the 16th ult., less rebate and plus exchange. 16. Receive an invoice from The American Cereal Company for merchandise which was ordered yesterday

author.particle: in settlement of a bill of

container-title: Receive order No. 43, sent in by mail. 17. Receive a check
note: to pay the bills of the 7th inst. 18. Order No. 43 has been filled. 18. Mr. Kennedy's expenses for the week, Feb. 13 to 18, have been $22.55. 18. Receive check (No. 31) from C. E. Brooks & Bro. for bills of the 8th inst. 18. Pay the salaries. 18. Deposit all checks on hand; deduct the amount of the exchange.
title: for the 30-day bill of Jan. 17; the balance of the check is to be applied on the 60-day bill of the same date. 10c exchange is added

note: 11, less discount. 23. Order No. 44 has been shipped.

Receive order No. 45.

author.literal: Feb. 24. Receive an invoice from Francis H. Leggett & Co.

note: Receive order No. 46, which is sent in by the traveling salesman. 24. Order No. 45 is filled. Follow instructions, which were given when the C. O. D. shipment was made on Jan. 30. Draw at nght through the Farmers State Bank, Janesville, Wis.
title: for sardines and olive oil
